Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, really!”
Reviews.Author: Lune14
Reviews.Content: You get a good measure of the service of a hotel when a few hours after booking you receive a mail from the concierge to offer you assistance for the upcoming trip. As per the many reviews here, Sanjay has such a touch for welcoming the guests of Artus that I can now attest that his reputation is rightfully deserved. Artus is located in the busiest strip of the 6th district, close to the St Germain church, which is my favorite portion of this area. There are limitless choices for dining and shopping literally as soon as you stumble out of the hotel. Despite that, with a room facing the inner courtyard, I got very little noise in the room except for a Saturday evening. Many hotels in this area have old windows, so the double glazed windows here were definitely a plus! All in all, the hotel hits high marks in all right points: location, the friendliest staff you find in Paris (from reception to the cleaning and restaurant staff, they were all wonderful), clean, decent room size and awesome rain shower! Try to book the room directly with the hotel with breakfast icluded. It was a superb continental option (some cooked items also), which included delicious breads and pastries, cheeses and meats, and to my great delight fresh juices (both grapefruit and orange, voila!) and fruit. You will hardly get better than this in Paris or elsewhere. This is definitely not the most luxurious hotel in Paris or in the area, but with the location, room features and above all, service, you just can't beat the value it offers. I will certainly be back here, hopefully very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Who can complain about this?”
Reviews.Author: Jacksy1
Reviews.Content: We often use Tripadvisor to rate hotels and this matched all the positive comments we read. I cannot understand why anyone would find fault. Value for money hasn't usually been expected in Paris hotels, and room size is always given as an excuse. We had no issues other than the open aspect to the bathroom area but it allowed space to be utilised perfectly to give a separate loo, spacious shower and a very good night's sleep. You are also in the "happening" part of Paris but the noise really didn't effect us. We would book direct in future rather than with Expedia but only because the breakfast would then be included and Sanjay on reception is so helpful we know we would get excellent service. We will use this hotel again and it has restored my faith in Paris hotels and La vie En Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lori330
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was a few doors down from where my daughter lives. Everything you want to do or see in Paris is within walking distance and the metro is a block away. The neighborhood is vibrant and safe and has an assortment of wonderful restaurants, galleries, cafes, and boutiques. Sanjay made us feel so welcome from the minute we arrived - it was very early in the morning and hours before the standard check-in time, so he brought us coffee and tea and managed to get a room ready for us in less than an hour. Our room was comfortable and had sufficient closet space to hang and fold clothing and even store our suitcases- it also felt more spacious thanks to the wonderful windows facing rue de Buci. The neighborhood can get busy on the weekends, but the triple-paned windows definitely help keep out the noise. Our bathroom was clean and updated with a terrific shower and vanity. The breakfast buffet is great (the croissants were better than the ones at Fauchon!) and includes a complete and wide assortment of breakfast items. Sanjay is an incredible asset to Artus. He is so professional, gracious, and hospitable. He greets you warmly every time you step into the lobby. Staying in this wonderful boutique style hotel feels more like staying at a friend's house.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: IAHurst
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel in February, book two double rooms. Both rooms we great, a little small but not over cramped. Facilities were good, tea making and mini bar, good ranges. Rooms were very clean and fresh. We had no view but that didn't really matter. Great metro links, two very close. Close to a lot of small independent art galleries which was great. Avoid the bar on the corner of the street, VERY expensive. Breakfast was good, lots to choose from. All round a great hotel and would go ans stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge, Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: julius17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in walking distance to almost everything! The rooms were bigger than I expected and there is a great buffet breakfast. The rooms and the hotel are also very nice and certainly has a boutique charm and feel. But what makes this hotel great and I mean really great is the concierge, Sanjay, and the staff. The staff is wonderful and are very pleasant and helpful. With regards to Sanjay he is one of a kind. I had numerous interactions with Sanjay prior to my arrival and he was wonderful. He makes your stay really great and he goes above and beyond. In fact, he went on vacation during our stay and still sent an email to check in and see how we were doing and to make sure everything was going as planned. He's truly a superb guy and made our stay at the hotel wonderful. Would definitely stay again without question.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel Artus, great location and stylish rooms”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay at the artus. having stayed at many local hotels this is a nice spot, very stylish, terrific breakfast options and great location. (on rue de buci but just off the blvd st germain). i'd be back again. only negative comment: front desk could have been a bit more welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “super site, style and service”
Reviews.Author: MMPJ1956
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit, this time sans children. The hotel is beautifully positioned, the room stylish and practical, the breakfast all one wants from a continental hotel and the staff (especially Sanjay) superb. Sanjay obtained opera/ballet tickets for us that were "sold out". Totally recommended as a super sited, stylish, service orientated well priced hotel

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home with European beauty”
Reviews.Author: psmeier
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just right! It is the perfect balance of 'brand name' hotels amenities and 'boutique' charm. The secure lobby is open 24 hrs a day with staff always available for help. The conceirge is expecting you and knows your name. I have never been greeted by name at a hotel before and remembered for the length of the trip. The rooms are small but have a key card entry system and modern amenities. The beds are incredibly comfortable, too! The hotel also has an included breakfast buffet that offers delicious Parisian and American food. I would stay at this hotel again. The neighborhood is perfect. It is right in the center of Paris within walking distance of most sites and great shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! This is a superb combination of great things!”
Reviews.Author: Prlski
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a jem! LOcation is perfect. Believe everything you read about Sanjay and the staff, they were all friendly, helpful, attentive, and very accommodating. I also need to add that yes the rooms are small, but the bathrooms are huge and well designed. And one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've slept in! You wOnt go wrong staying here

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - great service!”
Reviews.Author: Lucky7M7
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris to celebrate my 40th birthday. Wonderful experience all around. The Artus is perfectly positioned in the chic St Germain area - the heart of great shopping, famous cafes & wonderful restaurants . An easy walk to the Seine & the Latin Quarter. We have to give a special nod to the wonderful Sanjay! He was extremely attentive - even calling us prior to our trip - in response to some special requests my husband had made. Incredible! We picked this hotel based on the terrific TripAdvisor reviews & we were not disappointed. The hotel itself is chic, tidy and complete. The rooms are on the small side, which is typical in Paris, but are nicely appointed & comfortable and also feature a great bathroom. Very comfy bed as well. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Still maintaining the high quality”
Reviews.Author: shri420
Reviews.Content: We have visited the Hotel Artus on two other occasions, so were not surprised by the pleasant lobby, the excellent breakfast or the comfortable beds. And, because we knew we could count on him, we made a number of requests to the concierge Sanjay for tickets to the ballet and opera and a couple of other concerts and Paris museum passes. He didn't fail us--excellent seats and even wangled decent seats for the opening night of an opera at Opera Comique. The breakfast is priced at 20 Euros, and that cost might encourage exploration of other places in the neighborhood, however by booking on the hotel's own website (and prepaying), the breakfast was included at no extra charge. Compared to the usual Parisian 'very petite dejeuner' of other establishments, the meal is a winner. AND Breakfast is available from 7 am until 11 am. (This meant that on arrival the first morning, before the rooms were ready we could repair to the basement and enjoy excellent coffee and excellent food.) The location remains extremely convenient. Three metro stations are nearby, and a number of bus lines pass the vicinity. Walking the neighborhoodl is part of the experience, Rue de Buci and it's extension Rue Saint Andres-des Artes, offer an interesting range of shops, markets and restaurants, and if followed to Place Saint Michel, put you close to Notre Dame and to Sainte Chapelle. (Go early to avoid long lines.) The rooms are not large, but most folks don't go to Paris to watch CNN on the telly! We found it convenient to use taxis to museums--plenty of walking after reaching the Louvre or Musee d'Orsay. Here I would add a pitch for the Paris pass for museums. At least during holiday periods, the lines to enter can be huge and standing on a line for an hour or more is not the best preparation for exploring the arts inside. An additional suggestion--check out the local Marche St Germaine which is a block south of the intersection just down from the hotel; also get directions to the Village Voice Bookshop--a very good "Anglo-American" shop with a wide selection of books on Paris and France. I mention these local attractions simply as a pointer to how one can pace a visit to Paris--something in the morning, relaxation in the locality in the afternoon before a concert in the evening. In summation, the Artus is a great place to stay. It is 3-star and not an overstuffed luxury hotel, and for visiting this great city, it offers a wonderful home and base for exploring Paris and its environs.

Reviews.Title: “Always great!”
Reviews.Author: Rhetor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from Paris and our sixth stay at the Artus. As always, it was a great experience. The Artus has what we think is the best location in Paris at the the corner of the Boulevard St. Germain and the rue de Buci. The hotel is an easy walk to the Seine, Notre Dame and the islands, the Jardin du Luxembourg, and much more. The rooms are reasonably sized by Parisian standards and nicely equipped with custom furniture which maximizes the available space. The buffet breakfast is excellent thought, like all hotel breakfasts, pricey. Thereâ€™s branch of the Paul boulangerie/patisserie Â½ block away for a less expensive breakfast. On New Yearâ€™s Day the hotel offered an more elaborate (and complimentary) breakfast served later than usual. It is gestures like this that help make the Artus an exceptional hotel. But what really makes it exceptional, as just about every reviewer notes, is the presence of the concierge Sanjay. All of the staff are very good, but Sanjay is in a class by himself. He is simply the best concierge I have ever encountered. He is unfailingly friendly, efficient, knowledgeable, and helpful. We have now stayed at the Artus many times and he was just as helpful on our first visit as our sixth. My wife and I have often wondered if the management recognizes what a treasure they have in this guy. Presumably, if they read tripadviser, they do. The Artus is a great place to stay in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little gem in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: chocoplaty
Reviews.Content: From the slick website, easy online booking, to the warm welcome and restful stay at Artus, topped by a smooth shuttle arranged to the airport, everything was on point with this boutique hotel. Some of the highlights: Location of the hotel is perfect! Right in the middle of the lively Saint Germain des Pres area -- moments away from several metro stops, so many bars, restaurants, and boutiques right at the doorstep. Good value as well, very reasonably priced for the season. Service is exceptionally, warm, attentive, and friendly, especially from Sanjay and all the team. Staff also arranged an easy and last-minute airport transport for us, a great deal and super convenient. Well-appointed rooms with painstaking attention to detail: Fragonard bath products, Palais de Thes teabags provided in the room, Bose iPod docking station, etc etc Delicious hot/cold breakfast The only unexpected part of the stay for us as a family traveling together (grown siblings and parents) was that the bathroom is open without any door. Otherwise, superb stay, definitely look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: 99yl
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel Artus with my daughter for 2 nights. This was the third time I have stayed there and will do so again next time I am in Paris. Staff are nice and it is in a great location near the St Germain metro station .The rooms are attractive and comfortable. Free wireless internet and a good buffet breakfast with lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “If you are coming to Paris...you MUST stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lagoonguy
Reviews.Content: Quite simply...don't stay anywhere else!!! This hotel and the whole "Artus experience" is truly amazing! It was my first visit to Paris and I spent hours browsing the internet at countless hotels and reviews...and finally settled on the Artus...mostly because of its highly complementary reviews. I'm so glad I did because I was not disappointed! In fact it exceeded my expectations in all regards. The location is perfect...being just off the main Boulevard St Germain so you are right in the middle, of what in my opinion, is the best area of Paris with its chic cafes and restaurants. And being so central, you are only a short walk from many of the big attractions such as the Louvre and Notre Dame. In terms of the hotel itself...beautifully appointed with tasteful contemporary furnishings and our room was fabulous! It was on the top floor with its own balcony overlooking the street...wonderful view and the bathroom with jacuzzi bath was amazing!!! Everything was always spotlessly clean and the breakfast was brilliant...I real surprise! Sound impressive?! I haven't even got to the best part yet! It's what I refer to as the "Artus experience" which is almost solely because of one man...Sanjay the concierge. I have never stayed in a hotel anywhere with someone so knowledgeable and with such willingness to help with everything...I do mean everything!!! Especially for me, being my first visit to Paris, his help and advice was invaluable. Before my stay, I read the all the great feedback on Sanjay...everybody had a good word to say about him...but you have to actually be there to fully appreciate how amazing he is...unbelievable!!! Next time I go to Paris...I know where I will be staying!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in St. Germain de Pres”
Reviews.Author: Richard F
Reviews.Content: The Artus Hotel is just where you want to arrive after the trans-Atlantic flight to Paris. And, the Artus Hotel is just where you want to return after a day of enjoying Paris. It is an oasis, a sanctuary. The interiors of the lobby and the rooms are sleek and modern yet warm and invitingly comfortable. The staff... what can you say about Sanjay and everyone else we encountered? Say friendly, professional, and always with smiles for guests. Need dinner reservations? Sanjay and company never steered us wrong. We saw a poster for a performance of Vivaldi's Four Seasons at St. Chappel, Sanjay had two front row tickets for us. They do everything and they do it all exceedingly well. The location is the perfect base for Paris explorations whether on foot or by Metro. Stay at The Artus and you at the center of some of Paris' most exciting restaurants and iconic cafes, Les Deux Magots is just a block away! You can be sure that our return to our favorite city will include the Artus Hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Combination - Sanjay (the concierge) and the Hotel Artus”
Reviews.Author: harleydoc78
Reviews.Content: We could not have chosen a hotel in Paris better suited to our needs. The Hotel Artus was in a fabulous location, walking distance to everything and with the Metro and buses right at the corner. No matter what time of day we returned to the hotel, this specific street was lively and fun. All of the cafes and shops were open until all hours of the night, and your could eat, sip on some coffee, have a drink, of enjoy amazing ice cream any time you chose. The hotel was immaculate andthe breakfast was great. A nice way to start each day. But the highlight of the experience was Sanjay, the Artus's incredible concierge. Nothing was too much for him. All of our arrangements were made by Sanjay, even before we arrived. He obtained tickets for the Ballet, the Bateaux Mouches dinner cruise, a day in Loire Valley, a private walking food tour and tasting with a chef, a hilarious one man show called "How to Be Parisian in One Hour" and much more. He even checked up on us on his day off! We would love to return there, as Sanjay made it one of our most memorable vacations ever!

Reviews.Title: “Paris is awesome - Artus is a great location and Sanjay is great!”
Reviews.Author: JonathanMF23
Reviews.Content: I picked the Artus after seeing it in Fodors and since we never visited Paris - location was really important to us. The Artus was the perfect choice! Pros: The hotel was situated right in the center of the city with 3 Metros close by - one right across the street. The rooms were exactly what we expected for being in a big city. The breakfast was quite yummy with a decent selection. One of the best things was Sanjay! He is the hotel conceirge and he is awesome! Super helpful, and friendly. You can tell that he really enjoys his job! Cons: Rooms were on the small side but like I mentioned above it is in a major city. Walls in the rooms were unadorned given the name of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky”
Reviews.Author: Dommccall2107
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable stay here. Lovely room and nice staff. Loved the relaxed style of this hotel! Great location too, withing easy reach of great places to eat and things to see. Would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: ryuenau
Reviews.Content: Great area with lots of restaurants and lively atmosphere. Close walk to all the sites near Notre Dame and the Louvre. Free wifi with passcode. Close to a number of metros. Enjoyed walking down nearby Saint Michel and Andre des Arts. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bonita300
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of the wonderful reviews it received on TP, and especially because of the incredible Sanjay. He personally opened the front door and greeted us as we arrived after a long train journey from Germany following a river cruise. What a pleasure surprise! We were upgraded to Room 120 which was delightful. The bathroom was quite exquisite, all Carerra marble with nice toiletries and a towel warmer and a rainfall showerhead. The room was small like all Parisian rooms, but beautifully equipped. Breakfast was included and was wonderful and fresh. Great coffee! We would highly recommend staying here in this delightful, walkable neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, great area”
Reviews.Author: Brad S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. Room is small but that was expected and it was much bigger than the other three hotels we stayed in during out trip. The bathroom was much bigger than others. Shower was nice. It had a rainfall shower head and a hand held that worked at the same time. Seperate toliet. The bathroom even had a towel warmer. Free internet worked well. Breakfast is continental. Room was quiet. AC worked well and never got hot. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite trendy in a great location but should be better for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Ecotist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed out stay but left feeling quite disappointed because we were expecting better especially given reviews and a recommendation from a friend. When we arrived there were no towels in our room. The room was small - it was hard to get around the bed without head butting the TV on the wall. The bed wasn't a double but two singles with single matresses pushed together. Really disappointing if you are a couple trying to have a romantic weekend in Paris! On our final night we arrived back to the room to find that the coffee had not been replaced, empty milk packets next to the coffee machine and two dirty coffee mugs next to our bed with a satisfaction survey next to them! The air conditioning is quite noisey and you can hear people in nearby rooms taking showers etc. The wall on one side of the room had black scuff marks all over it and needed to be cleaned or re-painted as it really looked quite bad. Everything else was clean though. Breakfast was included but was nothing special and the service was poor. It took a while for someone to offer us coffee and even longer for them to bring us milk. The breads and cheese, cereals were nice but the scrambled eggs were tasteless. You would expect better for this class of hotel. They serve it 7:30 till 11 but one morning we Caen down at 10:15 and pretty much everything had gone and they were not replacing anything. They have a self service coffee machine in reception which looks free but they see you using it and charge 2:50 to room a pop. Sneaky! The staff were friendly and I liked the two big umbrellas in the wardrobe for us to use. Generally it Was not bad and we had a comfortable stay but I really think you can find better for the money and will probably try a B&B nexttime. I filled out the customer survey in the room but then they also sent it to me in two emails rather than thanking me for filling it out in the hotel! Artus - you need to improve and stop relying on your location!

Reviews.Title: “Very good and convinient hotel”
Reviews.Author: elpidoushka
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but smart. I had great view from my window of room 142 (4th floor) to bld. St. Germain. Location perfect- close to everything. Breakfast average,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne1950
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Artus Hotel for 6 nights in July. The location was perfect - in a bustling street with lots of retail and great places to eat. There are 3 Metro stations within a block or 2 of the hotel and if you love walking and exploring on foot, this hotel is perfectly located. It's an easy walk to the river, the Louvre, and many famous museums and sights. Our highest praise goes to the concierge, Sanjay. He was amazing! Nothing was too much trouble- from excellent restaurant recommendations to 2nd row tickets to the ballet, any request was met promptly and with a smile. A real asset to this Hotel. The choice for breakfast was quite generous and everything was fresh and nicely presented. The rooms are clean, contemporary and nicely fitted out but they are typically very small. The bathrooms are generous by comparison. If you don't mind a small room, this hotel is great value.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay for a couple!”
Reviews.Author: Feand
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in July and we are about to go back and stay again in August. What do you want in a hotel? Location - tick , Nice clean rooms - tick , Great staff/service- tick. Breakfast was also very good. This hotel exceeded our expectations!! Special mention to Sanjay who was an amazing host who even booked a car for us in Bordeaux. ** note the rooms are on the small side but don't be put off as this is typical by Paris standards. Excellent!! A & F Australia

Reviews.Title: “A true gem!”
Reviews.Author: garnevi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small, but modern, while still keeping historic charm. The staff was friendly, welcoming, and accomodating. They were patient with non-French speakers and offered helpful suggestions of things to do and places to eat. The location was perfect: near the Siene and a Metro stop in an area with plenty of shops and restaurants. The next time I am in Paris, I will be going back here!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Imagine Staying Elsewhere in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gailpearc
Reviews.Content: There is, I suppose, little to add to the other numerous raves regarding the Artus, but I canâ€™t imagine not chiming in regarding what is a truly remarkable 3-star hotel, full of style and â€“ most importantly â€“ not lacking substance for it. We thoroughly enjoyed our second stay at the Artus in late May and canâ€™t imagine staying elsewhere in Paris. The Artus experience starts with the warmest of welcomes; then, on to the rooms, which, while naturally on the petite side, are artfully decorated and appointed with built-in storage areas so as to make clever use of every available space. Boutique amenities and excellent beds/bedding add up to an extremely comfortable stay. The bar for comfort and joy is raised even higher by the staff (what a staff!), featuring Sanjay, a genuinely terrific individual and a consummate professional, for whom any and all requests are not only met, but surpassed, and who offers exceptional advice and recommendations for making guestsâ€™ Parisian experience all the more special. The Artus offers 5-star service in a 3-star establishment, in one of Parisâ€™ most compelling, conveniently located neighborhoods. In a word: parfait.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Smitty02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from staying at the Artus for 6 nights. Wen in Paris, London, NYC, etc., you're not in your room, all you need is a clean, nice hotel in a great location, but not overly expensive. When you're on the beach, you need luxurious accommodation in a great location (pay whatever it takes). The Artus fits the bill! It's a great location and affordable (Let's face it the $ is not strong and everything appears expensive). Our room was not spacious or overly luxurious, but clean and in a fabulous location. The staff was helpful, but there is one man that works in the day that stands out (he has worked there for 15 years). We would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was our second stay and it was as good as the first time”
Reviews.Author: awestesq
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right off of the boulevard. The Rue de Buci is very busy with numerous cafes and shops. There's also a supermarket right around the corner and two Metro stops less than a block away. The rooms are small, but generally clean. The rooms overlooking the street have windows that keep most of the noise out. The concierge, Sanjay, is very professional and resourceful. He was there for our first visit and we were glad to see that he's still at it. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, comfortable, and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LeoIrakliotis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in early July 2011. We were looking for a hotel on the left bank in the vicinity of the latin quarter and close to a Metro station. Artus was recommended to us by a friend and, based on the consistently positive reviews we read on TripAdvisor, we booked it. It was a good call. The hotel is located 400 yards away from the St Germain metro station, in a street off Blvd St Germain. The busy boulevard's noise drops off as soon as you turn into the hotel's street and by the time you are in your room it's so quiet you have a hard time believing you're in Paris. The rooms are typical size for continental hotels. The bathroom was roomy. The quality of the bed and the linens was superb (we stayed in room 131). The central air was dependable but don't expect the polar experience of American hotels. The hotel's online info and promotional material describe the room accurately. Free WiFi is available throughout the hotel and worked well in our room. The seating area at the lobby is spacious, comfortable, and well appointed. We did not have breakfast in the hotel because there were at least 3 boulangeries within 2 minute walk from the hotel and nothing beats a fresh warm croissant au beur in the morning, with a spot of cafe au lait. This hotel is situated near three very interesting locations: the Mariage Frere, a phenomenal purveyor of fine teas; Roger la Grenouille, the most respectable frog legs restaurant in Paris; and Laduree, a chic macaroons maker. All three are within 5 minutes walk from the hotel and we were very lucky to be able to visit them. The hotel's quaint street (Rue de Buci) turns into Rue St. Andres Des Arts and both are full of cafes, brasseries, and quite a few tourist shops. In summary this is a great hotel to be used as headquarters from venturing out and about the left bank and even further afield. We booked our room in advance and got a great rate. We shall return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and nice breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: supreme_opinion
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Artus. The location is excellent and well worth the premium paid for the area. Walk to some great restaurants nearby, plenty in 500m radius. Rooms are small but comfortable and clean and I would not expect much more than that in a high density area. Staff at the desk were helpful and welcoming. Sanjay in particular was very helpful to us and we appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “Vibrant area, stylish hotel, great welcome, nothing was too much trouble.”
Reviews.Author: JonathanHood
Reviews.Content: We had booked 8 rooms for demanding and discriminating senior directors (of which I am one) who are used to staying in the finest hotels around the world. After an exhausting travelling and business day we were flagging as the minibus delivered us to the door if the Artus. However the stylish entrance and lobby, marvellously warm weilcome and fuss free rapid check perked us up in monments, My request for a room change (nothing wrong with the room, just too close to the lift so possibly noisy) was responded to helpfully and quickly with no fuss. The rooms were compact but not pokey. Plenty of hangers in the wardrobe, chic modern styling, great bathrooms and TV and very firm but comfortable bed. A quick power-shower and change then fully refreshed, out into the heart of the vibrant Quartier Latin fro drinks and dinner. As much street life, bars, restaurants and beatiful people as you could want - although some of the bar prices are challenging - 70 euros for 6 beers a double vodka and a gin and tonic. Yes the street outside the hotel was noisy almost all night but if you want somewhere quiet (and dull) go to the Crillon! Breakfast was excellent. Taxi to airport booked actly as requested, handling changed instructions without hesitation or mistake, cases already placed in the cab as we completed our check out amazingly quickly and efficiently. Great stay. Yes we would certainly come back - as good as it gets for a boutique hotel in the beating heart of one of Europes most stylish cities.

Reviews.Title: “The Artus Hotel is the BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: susienora
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artus from May 10th through May 16th. The location is the best, the accommodations wonderful and the Staff--SUPERB! Sanjay is so wonderful. You can really tell he loves his job! He helped us with suggestions for restaurants, museums, even jazz clubs!! He made reservations for us and provided us with walking maps to our destinations. The best Concierge! All of the Staff at The Artus are wonderful and helpful. Our room was clean and contemporary with a great bathroom. Small by American standards, but PURRRFECT for PARIS!! I can't wait to return! Monica and Rick

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again, and again, and......”
Reviews.Author: NorgeGuy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here during a recent trip to Roland Garros for the French Open. The location in the Latin Quarter was perfect, close to the Metro, shopping and oodles of restaurants and cafes. Despite being on a busy street, with our room facing the buzz of the cafe society, it was quiet and peaceful. The room was just fine for our needs, and shower was great. Loved the breakfast, the art, the quirky decor, but particularly the staff. They were pleasant and helpful with restaurant reservations, taxi call and directions. Sanjay was first rate at the front desk. Great little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClassicMX5
Reviews.Content: Artus is a small boutique hotel located right in a â€˜buzzyâ€™ area of Saint Germain. Our room on the first floor backed onto a rear lane and was quite at night. A small lift gives you private access to your room whose size was very good for Paris. There was plenty of space for the two of us and it comes an excellent sized shower with the latest in tiles and fittings. A big plus is that there is a Laundromat on the next corner, opposite a bar, so you can do your washing while having a drink and keeping an eye on the machine. Also on the corner of the rear lane there is a good bottle shop to pick up some wine plus they speak English so selection of a local drop is easy. For a good local restaurant with no tourist menu, try Comme a Savonnieres, 18 Rue Guisarde, St Germain de Pres, quite near Saint-Sulpice. Fantastic food at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Mskeys
Reviews.Content: Well appointed and located, helpful staff, nothing too difficult including a midnight phone request from us for a tea bag. Wifi access with no hassles, and fantastic breakfast spread including eggs meat and cheeses as well as the regular French fare. What I liked the most though was the use of all of the best produce from the local area in the hotel, including teas by kusmi, bread from artisan on the boulevard, soaps etc etc. Also the location was superb, close to everything. Staff were happy to help with maps and directions. So many good things to say about our stay here, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in a very vibrant area”
Reviews.Author: seldomscene
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this small hotel. Our room was small, as one would expect, very clean and with a large and bright bathroom/dressing area. The shower was wonderful, I wish my shower at home was as nice. The lighting at the sink was super (important to me at least). Our room overlooked a small courtyard (if you leaned out and looked down) that was full of plants and looked lovely. Don't know how you got to it though. We slept well and NEVER heard any noise from the rest of the hotel or the street. I asked how full the hotel was since it was so quiet and was told it was full. The bed was comfortable, the room was sort of sleek/modern. The lobby of the hotel is full of art. The breakfasts were substantial: cheese, some meats, eggs, yoghurt, fresh baguettes and croissants. There is free wi-fi and a computer in the lobby for use. The front desk was great. Sanjay (who seems to be running the whole place) was pleasant, friendly and helpful as were the others at the desk at different times. He made reservations and suggestions on places to eat, where to buy museum tickets, etc. He apparently notified a restaurant where he made reservations that it was my birthday. I contacted him via email prior to our trip and he responded promptly, even called the house when I did not reply right away. He really makes a this place stand out by being so engaged. This hotel is in a great area, just off the Blvd St. Germain. The street is lively and full of cafes and bars and the famous cafes are just around the corner on St. Germain. The surrounding area is loaded with art galleries and lots of great shopping. It is a short walk to the river and the Louvre, also D'Orsay. We walked from the RER station (from the airport) to the hotel with our bags, it was just 6 or so blocks. It's really perfectly located. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves its reputation”
Reviews.Author: peggypatch
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights in a classic room at the Artus Hotel. The rooms are a little on the small side, but very nicely furnished and the bed was large, very comfortable and had a duvet, rather than sheets and blankets, which I appreciated. Although the hotel is on a busy street, we had a room overlooking a rear courtyard and it was very quiet at night. The bathroom was spacious and the shower large and good. The location is excellent, just a few steps from the metro and in the heart of St Germain de Pres, just a short walk to the Latin Quater and the Ile de la Cite. There are a myriad of shops, bars and restaurants right on your doorstep. The staff were all very welcoming and helpful and Sanjay was, just as the reviews suggested, extremely polite and went out of his way to be helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in a perfect location to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: SR32
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in Sept 2010 and couldn't have asked for a better hotel, comfy bed, quality linen, modern decor, friendly staff. We had a view of the tower from our room - everything about this place was perfect. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel when in Paris

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel in an unbeatable location with superior staff.”
Reviews.Author: kailan_sj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from a one week stay in Paris. We LOVE this hotel. (This is the first time I post an online hotel review, as I am usually too lazy to write one. This is an indication of how much I think this hotel deserve to be praised.) Room- We stay in the classic room, itâ€™s not big (just like most of the hotel rooms in Paris) but the chic and modern design make up for it. The queen size mattress of medium firmness is very comfortable and the Housekeeping does a very good job keeping the room very clean. Some reviews complain about the noise on the streets. In my experience, the room is very nice and quiet every day. It only gets a bit noisier on Saturday night when locals and tourists enjoy their late night out in the lively Saint-Germain neighborhood. But the hotel roomâ€™s double glazed windows kept most of the sound out and we didnâ€™t have any problem sleeping at all. Itâ€™s a matter of choice, if you want to stay in a lively and energetic area with countless cafes and musicians playing on the streets, a small and reasonable amount of sounds from the street has to be expected. Beside from the jetlag, we slept soundly for all 7 nights. Service- All the hotel staffs, including the famous Concierge Sanjay, are super friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to make your stay feel like home, helping us daily with directions and restaurant reservations. They attend to details that other big hotels normally do not. One time when coming back from a rainy day, we found that Housekeeping has left an umbrella in our room even though we did not request for one, we thought it was quite a special touch. Breakfast- Breakfast is included in our reservation so we had breakfast in the hotel every morning. The American-style breakfast has more varieties of food than Iâ€™ve expected. It has all the â€œbasis itemsâ€� like scramble eggs, sausage, bacon plus a nice selection of cheese and fresh fruit daily. A very nice way to start a day in Paris. Location- The hotelâ€™s location right in the middle of Saint Germian is unbeatable. Countless specialty shops, restaurants, cafÃ©s, food markets are just right outside the doorsteps! The hotel is about 3 mins walk from the metro station and 10 mins from the riverside (I am a slow walker as my husband always complain ^_^). We walked to Louvre Museum, MusÃ©e d'Orsay and Notre Dame all within 15-20 mins. I suppose one can do it faster if they walk fast, but itâ€™s a very nice stroll along the way to most of these places, with galleries and antiques stores along the pavements on the way to the riverside. So one may want to slow down and enjoy the walks.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel felt like home with the most friendly, helpful staff and location was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: CandABathurst
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the first floor. It was comfort with plenty of room to move around. The room faced a quiet street which was brilliant for sleep ins. We ended up having breakfast every day as the selection was fresh and yummy. The hotel is walking distance to restaurants, cafes, metro, tourist attractions and heaps more. Every single staff was so friendly, helpful and couldn't do enough for us. They always had some great advise.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sastillman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Artus from Dec 28, 2010- Jan 5, 2011. It was our second time staying at the hotel. We LOVE this quartier (neighborhood) in Paris as it is lively, easy walking to almost anywhere you want to go and filled with great restaurants and shops. I emailed with Sanjay (this hotel's famous consierge) numerous times prior to our arrival and he graciously helped us secure tickets to l'Opera and several restaurant reservations. Sanjay and his staff are welcoming, helpful, friendly and truly interested in ensuring the enjoyment of your stay. When we arrived at 6:30am on Dec 28, Sanjay greeted us at the entrance and was able to give us a room immediately. That was AWESOME!! The rooms are small but very well appointed and while in one of the busiest sections of the city, the rooms are also very quiet and calm. The breakfast provided by the hotel is another big plus. Great variety, fresh offerings and generous hospitality. I could go on and on but will just say, Artus is a hotel we will return to again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't want any sleep!!!!”
Reviews.Author: scubadoobaLondon
Reviews.Content: We started with rooms facing the front. Traffic wasn't the cause of the noise, but people spilling out of local bars and clubs till nearly six in the morning. Not a lot of sleep that night. The very helpful manager then moved us to a room facing the courtyard. Great we thought, no traffic. Sadly, and I don't know how the plumbing is routed, but it felt that it all went through our room. So if you are happy with an excellent location and friendly staff and NOT worried about a good night's sleep because you are out till the early hours, this is the place for you. If you enjoy a good night's sleep look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a terrific choice!”
Reviews.Author: happycat14
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Artus is a wonderful choice for a visit to Paris. It is in a great location with practically everything within walking distance. Even the Metro is only two short blocks away, and you will feel immersed in the Parisian lifestyle because the area has a 'local' flavor. My room was immaculate with a tub/shower and a comfortable bed. The best part - the staff. Everyone is extremely friendly and helpful. Several reviews mention the concierge, Sanjay, and for good reason! Sanjay is an invaluable resource who truly cares for his guests. When I was concerned about the road conditions due to the recent Paris snow, I contacted Sanjay and he gave me great advice for how to get to the hotel by train (by the way - train is 8.5 euros with a 5-minute walk to the Hotel Artus vs. 50-60 euros for a taxi from CDG). I arrived at the hotel after the long, overnight flight to be greeted by name by Sanjay. Now, that's VIP treatment! I highly recommend the Hotel Artus and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel for a romantic stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nick040
Reviews.Content: This is a small, lovely hotel. Rooms are efficient with luxury touches, although small. Hotel has everything we needed, including great chocolate, coffee, apples, a sauna, internet, etc. Mostly, though, it is in an incredible location -- from walking distance to most things, and a few metro options within a handful of blocks. Staff lovely and supportive. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Delight”
Reviews.Author: AinsleyD
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about my experience at this hotel. The staff is incredible, including the maestro himself, Sanjay, who is mentioned (with good reason) in many favorable reviews on this site. Everything from taxis to wake up calls to dinner reservations at one of the best restaurants at Paris were handled expeditiously and with a smile. Each staff member was personable, and was more than willing to assist both myself and my traveling companion in English. The complimentary breakfast was a formidable spread to me, and included pastries, those notorious French baguettes, different varieties of jams and spreads, eggs, cheeses, and meats. The fitness room had both a sauna and an exercise bike that suited my needs perfectly, and the room itself was comfortable, with an uber-modern shower and comfortable pillows, blankets, and bathrobes. If youâ€™re lucky enough to book a massage, you will not be disappointed. I didnâ€™t catch the womanâ€™s name, but she gave me the best massage of my life. Between the location in a fun, vibrant area of Paris, not too far from the Louvre, the Medieval Museum, or the Pantheon, and the boutique feeling that my accommodations had, Hotel Artus was one of the highlights of my trip to Paris. You will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MarciaBHBrazil
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband spent months searching for the perfect hotel for our honeymoon and Artus was perfect! We got a superior room and it was beautiful! The staff was always very helpfull and friendly and the breakfast was nice. Location couldnÂ´t be any better! Artus is close to two metro stations, several bars, cafes, restaurants, small shops and supermarkets! ItÂ´s also within walking distance of Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CoDublin
Reviews.Content: We booked the Artus hotel for our 20th wedding anniversary after reading reviews on TA and were not disappointed. Location fantastic - just off the Bvd Saint Germain. Can walk everywhere - we only used the metro once. Hotel rooms are small but this what you expect in Paris. Bathroom towel rail was extremely hot and potentially dangerous but this was pointed out to us on arrival. Breakfast was buffet and also good. Sanjay was as good as the other reviews have reported. Extremely helpful and charming - a wonderful asset for the hotel. He arranged for us to get a taxi back to the airport for only â‚¬17 pp so well worth taking this. We would certainly stay there again for the location and staff (particulary Sanjay!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: madeofdreams
Reviews.Content: We booked Artus Hotel through Tablet, based on the good reviews found on Tripadvisor. Sanjay was amazingly kind and helpful especially with finding us a street view room as we had requested. Artus Hotel has a great location, being located just off the main Blvd Saint Germain and just minutes from the Saint Germain Metro station. My husband used to dislike Paris but changed his mind completely after staying in this lovely neighbourhood and awesome hotel. The free Wifi was also a bonus! Thanks Sanjay, the staff of Artus Hotel for such a wonderful stay. We will definitely stay with Artus the next time we are in Paris! Recommended things to do in the neighbourhood: great pastry at Paul which is just a few minutes from Artus Hotel, getting lost in the streets of Rue de Buci and Blvd Saint Germain, short walk to Notre Dame, Le Christine, Laduree being just a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “small and simple - well done”
Reviews.Author: alsyd
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small - because the building's not huge, but they're very clean and well prepared and the decor is great. The concierge is excellent and it's an easy walk to the best of the St Germaine area. They do a really good job.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep and fantastic service + amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: meliss777
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Artus Hotel in mid-October 2010. Ill split the review into categories of things I find important when choosing a hotel to stay! Location: Excellent! It is either in the Latin Quarter or just outside - we have wandered all over Paris, and this is a great area to stay. It was busy at all hours of day and night, so you feel very safe, and the busyness isnt tourists - its locals, which just makes the experience so much better. A plethora of great bars, restaurants and shops, cool little side streets, minutes away from the Notre Dame and the Seine.....just great. Its fairly far from the Eiffel Tower/Arc de Triomphe, but just use the metro! Honestly, we stayed near the Eiffel Tower and the area is kind of barren except for tourists. Location is best for if you want to go out at night/for apertifs, but also good for anyone really. Room: Small, but thats expected in Paris. Really clean, modern and well maintained. Bed was lovely - really comfortable and nice linens. Good pillows. Bathroom is a bit strange (a curtain as a door!) but clean, pretty spacious and good shower. Free wi fi that was REALLY fast. Nice tea! Service: Lovely service, great English skills and helpful. We wanted extra nights, and they had no availability, but in the morning we got a call from them letting us know they had availability due to a cancellation - and we hadnt asked them to call! I liked that they remembered. All in all, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rob44139
Reviews.Content: Recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris. The location is terrific and the staff very friendly. Sanjay and his team are knowledgeable about the area and the hotel is a great value including breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: nebraskaresident
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 6 nights at this hotel. We will be back. It is in a super location ( one block off St Germain ) , close to a metro station, a short walk to museums, Notre Dame, the Seine, Latin Quarter, shopping, etc. The staff is exceptional. ( To the hotel management.....I hope you realize what a gem Sanjay is ) I would recommend using the transportation that the hotel can arrange as pick up and drop off to the airport. Back to the hotel....this was our 5th trip to Paris, but the first time we stayed here. I am so glad we did. The breakfast included was very nice. The hotel is clean. The room we had was at the back of the hotel, conducive to a very quiet stay. Thumbs up, all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ThomasheenOgRua
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of the funky Left Bank. The hotel is conveniently located for all the major attractions Paris has to offer. The bedrooms are functional and comfortable. Rather strangely, the shower forms part of the bedroom, which is not necessarily a bad thing (!!) As many other posters on here have mentioned, the concierge Sanjay makes this hotel experience extra special. He had great recommendations for restaurants and bars. Would I stay here again? Absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful spot, ideal location for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: JMS82
Reviews.Content: Artus was a great hotel - modern amenities and design, a wonderful staff (esp. Sanjay the concierge) and most importantly, an ideal location for those looking to explore Paris. Right off St Germain, the hotel is within walking distance of the Lourve, Notre Dame, D'Orsay and the Luxumbeorg Gardens. Also very near the Latin Quarter and all its cafes and charm. Overall, there isn't really any negatives - you just should not expect a typical American-sized room. But that is not idiosyncratic of Artus - all of Paris hotel rooms would be considered small by middle Americans. But most Americans will be very pleased with the bathrooms, which I would consider very large by Paris standards. The waterfall showers are awesome. If Sanjay is working as conciege, rest assured that you will be in excellent hands to arrange reservations, make recommendations and for general insight for the best times and methods to go to the sights across Paris

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location... and Sanjay made it feel like home!”
Reviews.Author: misskeiko
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so perfectly located... right off the Metro line (Mabillion) and walking distance to the Lourve, Notre Dame, and TONS of cafe's and shopping. But what really made it special was Sanjay (the concierge). It was our first visit to Paris and our first stop once we'd landed from long flight and train ride... we were tired, hungry, and jet lagged but from the moment we walked in the door, Sanjay's warm smile and sincere welcome brightened us up right away. Our room was ready (even though we were early) and he checked us in quickly and offered any assistance we needed to get set on our way. He gave us great recommendations for the area over the course of the 3 days we were there... it was like staying at a friends house. :) The hotel itself is very clean, nice, and in a perfect location (St. Germaine is wonderful!!)... the room we stayed in was a little small but because it was on the 6th floor it had a decent view (and we didn't have to stare at the concrete wall). :) When I go back to Paris... if I decide to stay in St. Germaine again... I will stay at the Artus and I can only hope that Sanjay will still be there!! :) Thanks Sanjay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Supurb Staff Sets the Tone”
Reviews.Author: Bldd21
Reviews.Content: Lodged in the heart of bustling St Germain des Pres, Artus Hotel provides a respite. Recently stayed there for 5 nights and was struck, as I was 10 years ago, by the caring and professional staff . Their attention to detail, coupled with the well-designed rooms and fabulous nutritious breakfast, all contribute to a traveler's well being.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home ... Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: clafave
Reviews.Content: I just came back from 2 weeks in France, the last 5 in Paris staying at the Artus Hotel. I loved it. I stayed in a suite with balcony on the top floor, and enjoyed a lovely view across the rooftops of Saint Germain-des-PrÃ©s. The hotel is located in the middle of all the action in this part of town, and is convenient walking distance to many famous sites, such as Notre Dame, the Seine, the Louvre and so much more ... and with the metro and bus stops just a block or two away, it was a wonderful base to explore Paris. I spent many years serving as a senior executive at one of the world's best known luxury adventure travel companies and can say that I have enjoyed few hotels as much as I did the Artus Hotel. Thoroughly comfortable, it certainly isn't over the top like many of the most expensive places one might stay. Instead, it felt quite homey ... fact is, my friend and I kept referring to the hotel as "home" and I, despite traveling to all 7 continents for work and staying at many wonderful hotels, have never done that before. The whole place had a sense of intimacy about it, as if you were visiting friends of the family. And I can't say enough about the staff, who were unfailingly friendly and helpful. I would be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an intimate hotel in the middle of it all. Have fun in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for first time in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ElaineandKen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights after finding it online. It had been recently refurbished and is a nice boutique hotel with an arty feel about it. It is right in the area of St. Germaine and is perfectly situated for cares and restaurants and of course all the amazing sights of Paris. We knew not to expect too much of room sizes in Paris but were pleasantly surprised, whoever designed the room layouts managed to get everything in that you need and used the space creatively. We did not have the feeling that the room had to be endured for the purpose of being in Paris, it was one of the good parts of being there. The breakfast buffet was good without being sumptuous and set the right tone for our days exploring the city. The staff were fantastic, nothing was too much trouble and they all spoke English which was another bonus. To say we were right in the hustle and bustle we slept soundly at night with no noise from other rooms or the bustling streets. The lift in the hotel, which was slow and really small was quaint and amusing. It is not a multi-storey place so the stairs were a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ded33157
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of June. Sanjay and the whole staff were welcoming and very helpful. Great location right off of Blvd. St. Germain. Easy walking distance to shopping and restaurants, longer strolls to the Eiffel Tower (about an hour-but a great walk).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value, and Sanjay is the best”
Reviews.Author: VinDivine
Reviews.Content: We just ended our third stay over the past few years at Artus, and again had a great stay. We're picky about our hotels, and have stayed at De Crillon and Bristol in Paris, (both highly rated and expensive). There's just something about being right on Rue de Buci, always greeted warmly by the staff, and the rooms that by French standards are good sized and well laid out. Plus the Manager, Sanjay is always helpful, very pleasant and always makes sure you we're taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel where we could step out the door and find everything we wanted”
Reviews.Author: paul-charlotte
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris and were really concerned about finding a good hotel at a reasonable price. The Artus was perfect and Sanjay, the Concierge made us feel so welcome throughout the whole of our stay. Helpful and knowledgeable he is a great credit to the hotel. Outside the hotel you have wonderful resturants, cafes and bars, that were lively but not rowdy. Handy for the both the metro system and within easy walking distance of the Seine, Notre Dame and the Louvre. The breakfast is really good and will easily get you through the day. Would certainly recommend this hotel. Did not sample the SPA but only because we did not have time.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel gives you a true Paris experience!”
Reviews.Author: Haskins1111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location to experience what Paris is all about. It is within walking distance to many of the museums 10-15 min. The metro is literally across the street, and all the food and drinks are on the same street as the hotel. Sanjay was better than I could have ever imagined! He made us feel like we were family, and was great at answering any questions we had. We stayed in two different rooms due to us adding a day to our trip, which worked out great giving us an experience of the courtyard view and a street view. The courtyard was silent with no noise from the street if that is what you like. I enjoyed the street view although noisy when the window is open it allowed me to watch the busy street while the wife was getting ready. The internet worked perfect the entire time and was super fast. The wife and I can not say enough good things about this hotel and would definitely stay here again. If you are on the bubble about staying at this hotel, do it, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: CherylAS
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the TA reviews and it didn't disappoint. The St. Germain district is now my favourite area to stay in Paris. You walk out the door of the hotel and there are tons of restaurants, bakeries and shops to choose from. It feels like this is where the locals hang out. It's within easy walking distance to the Louvre and Notre Dame, and the Eiffel Tower is approx. a 45 minute walk. The Metro is right around the corner. As expected Sanjay was superb. We had an issue with our return flight home after the volcano and he made numerous phone calls for me and even phoned my cell to see if we'd made it home OK! As other reviews have mentioned, the other staff are all great as well. Our room, #151, was a good size for a Paris hotel and very quiet, overlooking the courtyard. The bathroom is gorgeous; the shower is huge and with fantastic water pressure. There was ample storage and the bed was comfortable. The only negative we noticed with the room is the carpet was a bit worn. The breakfast room is cute and there was a good variety of food to choose from. There is free wi-fi and a computer in the lobby for guest use. We had some fabulous meals and recommend these 3 restaurants: Au Beaujolais - we had lots of fun here with the waiter Alfred and the other server. The food was good, and very reasonable. I'm vegetarian and they made a special dish for me. Le Christine - the food here was absolutely fantastic. Fish - a great little restaurant with lots of atmosphere and good food.

Reviews.Title: “It could be better”
Reviews.Author: santjordi
Reviews.Content: We were volcanoed into Paris and my Brother and I were able to get rooms in this hotel. We felt very fortunate to find two rooms in the same hotel. The rooms were clean, the decor was bright and contemporary, and the breakfasts large. The reception/concierge staff really are worth singling out. Wireless internet connections were spotty, but some of the time the wired computer in the lobby didn't connect either. The rooms however were definitely lacking. One room was small and noisy (it faced the street) the other room was large and somewhat-less-noisy, but not quiet (it was on the Alley and had the added non-bonus of cigarette fumes when the windows were opened) The truth be told, the hotel has double paned windows, so they have tried, but it is in a VERY popular part of the Latin Quarter. Also the hotel is not at all inexpensive, and for the money, I think you can do much better

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcCalg
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed for 3 nights March 27-30. The other reviews are spot on - this is a perfect small hotel in a great location close to metro, many cafes and restaurants and within walking distance of all the major Paris attractions. The rooms are small but nicely appointed and with modern bathrooms, very comfortable. Sanjay lived up to his reputation and provided us with thoughtful touches that made our stay all the more pleasant. All of the other staff were polite & friendly as well. We didn't sample breakfast as the local cafes were so attractive. I would definitely recommend this hotel and the St Germain area in general, and will definitely stay there again next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: parkavegirl
Reviews.Content: We booked the Artus for our first trip to Paris. I did a lot of research before booking. I chose the Artus because of it's ideal location and great reviews - I chose right! This is the PERFECT location! It is on a great street with many cafe's, pastry shops, and little food marts. It also doesn't feel touristy at all, which was something that was important to us. You get a real feel for Paris. I would just walk around and get lost along the little side streets by the hotel, they are all so charming.We would stop at the many little restaurants on Rue Di Buci for a late afternoon cocktail. Everyone just sits outside and people watch while sipping their cocktails. The hotel is small but very chic and clean. We had room 116, facing rue di buci. The room was great (small, but probably big compared to other Paris hotels) everything was very clean, and the shower was great. As some of the other reviews said there is no door to where the shower is. (there is a little curtain that pulls down though) For us this was totally fine as I was my husband, but I can see it posing a problem if you were traveling with someone you didn't want to "see in their birthday suit" Sanjay was also very helpful. He called us before our stay to see if there was anything he could do for us. He made dinner reservations for us before we arrived and even printed out the map quest route to walk to the restaurants and put it in our room for us. He also called a car for us to pick us up from the train station for 50 euros -- which wasn't cheap but well worth it. The driver was waiting for us at the end of the quay with a sign with our name on it. We had breakfast included and it was just fine. They had croisants, cereal, yogurt, egss & bacon. I don't know if it is included for everyone, but was easy enough to grab a quick bite before heading out for the day. if you don't have breakfast included there are plenty of little cafe's on the hotel's street and a Paul across the street which has all the croisants and pastries, etc. Bottom line - this was a GREAT hotel and I would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling to Paris. Just a side note for someone wanting a unique experience while in Pairs - "Left Bank Scooters". We booked this tour and it was amazing -- check it out on trip advisor, I highly recommend! Feel free to email me with any questions you may have!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in ideal location!”
Reviews.Author: melodicmartin
Reviews.Content: My French workmate recommended we stay in the St Germain des Pres district, as it was less obviously touristy than other parts of Paris - and she was right. It's a lovely neighbourhood, full of delightful cafes, markets and shops. It seemed like "proper" Paris! Artus Hotel fitted in perfectly. Quaint, friendly and superbly located. The rooms are small - we were in room 114, which overlooked the street. But the fittings were very swish (the bathroom was excellent) and the bed very comfy. The staff were excellent; and the bonus of a small sauna room, after a long day peddling the Paris streets, was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheshire_boy20
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a superb bustling location surrounded by great Bistros, Bakeries and Cafe's. From this hotel we walked to the Louvre and Notre Dame well within 20 minutes along lovely streets with lots of Boutique shops and Cafe's. The area feels like the real Paris with no 'touristy' trappings in sight. The Artus Hotel is a very welcoming place and the staff are only too happy to help inparticular (the now famous on Trip Advisor) Sanjay who was just lovely. The room we stayed in was more than we expected for a city hotel. Modern, exceptionally clean and very comfortable. Would we stay there again? WITHOUT DOUBT!! For the price we paid we'd recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, awesome, awesome”
Reviews.Author: ErrantXavier
Reviews.Content: I took my partner here for her birthday, booking this hotel through the Eurostar website after checking the reviews on this very website. The reviews are accurate, this hotel is awesome. Its central in the Saint-Germaine area of Paris - you step off the Metro and you're at the hotel and the sights of Paris are all close by. Sanjay is named by many as being one of the selling points for this hotel and they're not wrong. I've never met a concierge like him. He recommended a perfect restaurant for us and whilst we were out, got us a reservation, printed directions and left a lovely little note for us about it upon our return. His recommendation was spot on. I feel sorry for the other staff because Sanjay gets so much attention! They were all helpful and friendly too, but Sanjay simply knows his way around the area and is an exemplar of Service. Room was a 'classic' room on the first floor overlooking the inner light well but we loved it. My other half didn't want to leave. We didn't sample breakfast at the hotel because we were happy to have a lie-in but there are plenty of places close by to grab food, even if you miss breakfast at the hotel. Perfect hotel. Would definitely recommend to anyone who is looking for a short trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel in exceptional circumstances”
Reviews.Author: Blubell
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say thanks to The Hotel Artus for making a potential disastrous "long weekend" as painless as possible. We were victims of the Eurostar snowgate episode just prior to Christmas and the hotel could not have been more helpful and accommodating. The hotel itself is lovely and very central. I would throughly recommend for both its staff, its location and its value. Lovely..after 4 days stuck in Paris it began to feel like home!

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel at Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hwelsh
Reviews.Content: Overall hotel experience was amazing. Hotel Staff was extremely friendly and always ready to help. Hotel Location is excellent with a metro station less than one block away. You can walk to almost any important place at the city. (Latin Quarter, NotreDame, Louvre, Champs Eysees) Room size is a bit bigger than Paris standards. Great value for price paid. I will not hesitate to come back any time IÂ´m at Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Andrea B
Reviews.Content: The pros: The location was superb: surrounded by restaurants and food markets, with a large amount of the main places to see in Paris within easy walking distance, and the Metro very close. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The staff, from reception to kitcen to cleaning staff, were all helpful and friendly, providing good recommendations on where to eat, remembering my beverage of choice at breakfast, and so on. The hotel was kept spotless, and my room was well cleaned every day. It was helpful to have breakfast provided, with a range of choices to suit eveyone's tastes (I particularly liked having some egg at breakfast). I was pleasantly surprised to find an electric jug in the room so I could make my own tea, and the tea provided was excellent quaity. I loved the view, and despite being on the street was amazingly quiet. Only one nght (on a weekend), late, did I hear celebrations on the street, but that ony served to remind me of the lively location. The wireless access was speedy and worked well every day. The cons: While it is to be expected that rooms are small in Paris, this was a bit smaller than I would have preferred, but because all of the other points listed above far outweight the impact of this, I would still go back there in a heartbeat, and still recommend it to anyone I come across planning to visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: NYCtoAustin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Artus hotel for our first trip to Paris. We stayed there for six nights in the junior suite. We got a great rate off Travelocity. I am very picky about hotel rooms and we would definitely recommend this hotel. Room: The junior suite was large for a European hotel. The bed was very low but comfortable. The bathroom was very large and had a big jacuzzi, two sinks, and separate shower. It was the perfect size for the two of us. The only problem I could think of was the street noise. It's a busy street so you will always hear people talking and police cars going by. It didn't bother us, but it might if you are a light sleeper. Service: I agree with everyone's thoughts about Sanjay. He goes out of his way to provide the best service possible. He is very considerate. The rest of the staff was ok. They were nice enough, but were nothing like Sanjay. Location: I loved the location. The Mabillion station is across the street and the St. Germain station is about 2 blocks away. There are lots of shops and restaurants around and there is a market on Tuesday-Saturday mornings on Rue de Buci. It was cold when we were there, but we were still able to walk to all the major sites. It was the perfect location for our first visit.

Reviews.Title: “My 4th Stay at the Artus!”
Reviews.Author: mcal3K
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel for the location and the service at the front desk. The area of rue Buci and its surroundings just can't be beat. It is a market street itself, and it is surrounded by other streets full of bars, restaurants, history, and life. It is safe, it is fun, it never sleeps. In addition to the location, the front desk service is excellent. Sanjay helps with any need you may have and is detail oriented in every way. The staff never tires of giving directions and recommendations. If it's a quiet street you prefer, best not stay here, however. But if you want to be in the middle of everything, what a great choice. And from this location it is also easy to orient yourself to traveling to other parts of the city quite easily, whether by metro or on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Sanjay made our stay at the Artus Hotel Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: MPSerenbe
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Artus Hotel and I would never stay anywhere else while in Paris. The first trip was with my husband and this trip was with my sister (leaving husbands and children at home). We booked the Junior Suite and loved our spacious room and the gorgeous view from our balcony. Sanjay is an absolute treasure. Although I adore the hotel, the reason we came back and will continue coming back is the wonderful hospitality of Sanjay. He booked fabulous restaurants for us, gave fantastic recommendations and is the hardest worker with a constant smile on his face. I am already planning my next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to base your Paris Trip but Rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: Adrian&Rohan
Reviews.Content: The Artus was the perfect location to base our Trip to Paris and very central to allow you to walk to most of the sites and experience the feel of the city, or just as close to several Metro lines if you were in a hurry. The rooms were clean but very small and only a couple of them actually have views. Ours overlooked an internal courtyard where I think the bins were kept. Again like most places in Paris it was very expensive even if with online rates but for the prices you paid you would expect that the "Instant Coffee and Tea" provided in the rooms would have been included and not an additional charge, so we opted to go across the road to Pauls instead for Coffee and Breakfast. The staff were as helpful as they could be but if you could not speak French then it was a real effort to even get something as simple as a top sheet for the bed. During our 5 day stay we only managed to get someone who spoke English on the day that we checked in. Overall a nice Hotel, Great location.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot describe how great this is.”
Reviews.Author: basil1980
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I have to say that this hotel has the "hands down" the worlds greatest concierge. The service at this hotel is simply unbelievable. I cannot say enough about how great the service was. After booking this hotel on Tablet, I received an email and phone call from the concierge Sanjay asking if there was anything that he could do to improve our stay. What followed was... they booked an e-class mercedes to pick us up from the airport... they had a folder with excellent restaurants to visit during our stay. They also had selected 5 hotels for us to stay when we went down south to Saint Tropez. All of their recommendations were perfect. Further, my wife caught the flu... they had a doctor in our room in under 30 minutes. Also, they had organized us information for the opera, by shows, location, price and the good and bad of each one. Not only is Sanjay a legend.. but the other concierge people as well. The location of the hotel is perfect. Walking distance to everywhere. Excellent bistro's, restuarants and shopping only minutes away. The rooms itself for Paris standards is great. Overall... super happy with the hotel. Definitely recommending it to my friends... and heading back there ASAP.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located; Helpful Staff; Decent (but small) Rooms”
Reviews.Author: wxl
Reviews.Content: Good Things: the Artus Hotel is well located. It's only 5 minutes walk from Odeon metro station, which is itself only about 20 minutes on a direct line (i.e. no changes) from Gare du Nord. Once at the Artus, you can walk to many places of interest for sightseeing, and there is no lack of choice of restaurants and interesting shops and/or street sights. This was my 2nd stay at the Artus (the 1st being many years previously) and I would stay again, subject to planning a few things better (see the next paragraph). The Reception staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. The room and the rest of the hotel were very clean. Things To Improve: First, ask for a large room that is not on the ground floor - the reason is that the ground floor rooms are small and look out directly on to the street (although are very quiet). Secondly, the beds are shorter than average and (even at 6 foot tall) I was hanging over the end. Third: the rooms don't come with bathrobes. Fourth: I was surprised that that the breakfast buffet (which was fresh, but limited) cost Euro 15 - the next time I would eat out instead. Finally: check out (at 11:30) was a little early.

Reviews.Title: “Stop driving yourself nuts looking. STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: aprice88
Reviews.Content: I spent way too many hours researching hotels on TripAdvisor (and elsewhere). This was our 1st trip to Paris and it was tough to narrow down a selection. Once we decided on the St Germain area it became easier, but still overwhelming. I called around and, based on price and the trip advsior reviews, chose the Artus. For us, it was perfect. The area was GREAT. Very cool and fun area and also around the block from the Metro. We also walked alllllll over Paris and this was a convenient starting point. Also, the best part about the hotel is Sanjay, the concierge/receptionist/the nicest person ever. Once he understood our traveling requests he do things like make our reservations to dinner without us even asking! He was extremely helpful and very kind and he really goes above and beyond to make sure you enjoy your stay. As mentioned in other postings the rooms are small but completely adequate and quite nice. They are clean, elegant, and modern. Our window opened up to Rue De Buci, which was a lively and fun scene to be a part of. Our rate also included free wifi and breakfast which was great.
