We'll be back to the Artus and we plan to tell all of our friends about it. I couldn't find anything even close in this price range. The only reason it would be worth paying more is if you must have a larger room. Otherwise, the Artus is the way to go. A great home base and a almost a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SuZeeDee
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels in the major European cities, and they tend to be expensive and tiny - but the Artus gave me hope! We got a really good deal on the room - and the room was lovely by the standards I've mentioned above. Clean, not so tiny, no problem with the bathroom, and the breakfast was really good! The location was fantastic - within 10mins easy walk of the Louvre, Notre Dame, and many other attractions. The locale immediately surrounding the hotel was really lovely. Many typical Parisian bars and restaurants, so we didn't have to wander far at night. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice palce to say in Paris that will leave you a few euro to enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “excellent botique hotel in lively area”
Reviews.Author: travel_chiq
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed in Paris just on my own. I traveled with my cousin who arranged for us to stay at the Artus Hotel in St-Germain-des-Pres District of Paris. This was her first time in Paris, but on the advice of a Parisian friend, this area was a great place to stay for one's first . And he did not disappoint! We were happy to find this excellent and trendy little hotel just off of Boulevard Saint-Germain (Mabillon Metro stop). We had a double room and found it comfortable and clean. It was small in area and a little tight to get around, but that was to be expected for Parisian hotels. Our room had a great view of the lively Paris street Rue de Buci. Street noise could be a problem, but we welcomed it. The shower and sink area was separated from the rest of the room by a dividing wall, but the toilet was in a closed room. This hotel is very trendy with elegant modern sink and shower fixtures. Rain shower head was a treat! All the usual amenities were provided, mini fridge/min-bar, tea and coffee, flat screen TV, iPod docking station was a nice touch. Included breakfast was very nice. There is free internet access in the lobby. The staff was friendly and very helpful. All in all I would say that this was a very comfortable and convenient hotel, at reasonable rates, to stay in and still be in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Small but very nice and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ken2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at Artus Hotel because it was so conveniently located. It is surrounded by cafes, bars, brasseries, shops, etc. Also walking distance to the Seine and Notre Dame. The subway is also very nearby. Breakfast was great and also the free wifi. All the front desk people were friendly and great hosts, especially Sanjay. The room we had though was very small although this is really typical in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: OftenTravelling
Reviews.Content: This small hotel just seems to get better and better. Well located in St. Germain. Very good breakfast. Reasonably priced making it very good value all around. The staff are helpful, friendly, engaged and capable. Artus seems to be getting more and more popular as it is becoming more and more difficult to secure a last-minute reservation. All in all though, a top-pick for a reasonably priced Paris hotel in St. Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms ok”
Reviews.Author: dax97
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel which was in the St. Germain area. Walking distance to the Louvre and right beside St. Germain street with all the bars and restaurants. Sanjay, the concierge was great, with recommendations and lending us umbrellas when it was pouring outside. The room was just ok, small compared to North American standards and even other hotels we stayed at in Spain and Portugal but we heard that is typical for Paris. Our bathroom sliding door was broken and therefore always open which caused us some discomfort as it was a small room but otherwise room was clean and no real noise issues. If you come back to the hotel late at night, you have to ring a bell so the nightclerk can open the door for you. Found the nightclerk a bit questionable so I would recommend all questions be directed to Sanjay who was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Our wonderful home in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: kateandgary
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the Artus and it never ceases to delight. The rooms (although small by North American standards) our very well appointed with every amenity needed for a great stay - wonderful rainshower, in room wireless internet and safe, high quality linens and bedding and huge thick towels just to name a few.... Our friend Sanjay (the hotel's helpful and friendly concierge) is always delighted to arrange reservations and provide information on attractions throughout the city. This small hotel located steps from beautiful St. Germaine de Pres in the lively Latin Quarter on the Left Bank, is in the heart of a lovely vibrant neighbourhood with fabulous shops and great restaurants and bistros and is within walking distance of most of the wonderful sights and experiences of Paris. Fabulous location. Thank you Sanjay, Christophe and everyone for once again making our stay in Paris a lovely experience. See you again soon. Kate & Gary

Reviews.Title: “Hotel of Choice”
Reviews.Author: Intermanaut
Reviews.Content: Whenever I return to Paris Iâ€™ll always use this hotel. Its location is spot-on - far enough away from the tourist traps, but close enough to metro stations to get you to them. Itâ€™s about 10 minutesâ€™ walk to the Louvre, but also has three metros within five minutes to get you further afield. From CDG itâ€™s easy to get to using RER and metro, taking about 30 minutes in all. The room was excellent - a massive bed, large LCD TV, wireless internet, a fantastic shower, and overlooked the bustling Rue de Buci. The staff we met were all incredibly friendly, especially the concierge who always stopped for a chat each morning and evening. Itâ€™s a lovely, small, and intimate hotel in a stunning part of Paris. If you want to be away from hordes of tourists where you can wander through narrow streets and sit for a coffee to watch the world go by, Artus is the place to stay. In the evenings, head for... ...Caveau de la Huchette for jazz - live bands until the small hours, and very reasonable bar prices. ...Cocotte Jolie for excellent food in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere. Youâ€™ll be surrounded by some quite weird dÃ©cor (very small plants in very small buckets) but the food is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: tangsoodo
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel in a perfect location. What other trip advisor members have said about Sanjay is right on track...he is welcoming, helpful and a great resource for restaurant recommendations, metro trips, etc. The Artus is a great "home base" from which to explore the city - with easy metro access, good restaurants nearby, and interesting streets to explore at night. Our room (#102) was good-sized (for Paris) and had a great walk-in marble shower. There was a bit of noise from the people in the alley outside the Latin Music bar over the weekend, but it wasn't a major issue for us (it's to be expected in the heart of the city). We'd definitely return to the Artus for our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service”
Reviews.Author: SteveK60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have both lived in Paris and were looking for the right hotel for our first visit there together. We couldn't have chosen a better location than the Artus. It's in the heart of the Left Bank, just steps from Blvd. St. Germain and a short walk to numerous tourist sites, restaurants, and shops. Rue de Buci itself has a number of cafes, food markets, and boutiques. We were also impressed with our room, which was quite spacious for a Paris hotel -- king-size bed, room for two to stand and walk around comfortably, and a huge modern bathroom. Our room was on the ground floor (in the rear) but the soundproofing was incredible; we could barely hear any street noise. The staff was very attentive. Sanjay the concierge contacted us weeks before our arrival to ask if he could do anything for us and even followed up after we came home. Our only complaint is that our bed was too hard, but we were given extra comforters and pillows to soften it.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed there for my 50th birthday.”
Reviews.Author: Ellenchantress
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Paris for my birthday, en route back from two weeks in Morocco. We chose The Artus Hotel for it's location, and quite enjoyed our stay. The service was great and the rooms were cleverly designed, albeit tiny. The artwork in the hotel itself was lovely, and the rooms had no art on the walls at all....a touch I particularly liked very much. The lobby of the hotel was perfumed via a lampe berger which was welcoming and not cloying - a delightful touch after a day of tramping around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Better than you could imagine”
Reviews.Author: tunafellows
Reviews.Content: I took my two sons ages 14 and 12 to Paris for three days over 1/2 term and we stayed at the Artus Hotel for two lovely nights. I knew I wanted to be central and stay in St. Germain because I wanted to introduce the boys to Paris through walking. We are quite fussy about our hotels and I did quite a bit of research beforehand. In the end, I chose the Artus because of all the reviews I had read about Sanjay - the most helpful, friendly concierge ever. My husband had to be elsewhere on business and therefore this was my first trip to a foreign city as a single parent. Knowing there would be a helpful, friendly hand available was very important to me. Sanjay did not disappoint. He was incredibly knowledgeable about anything you needed to know about Paris - restaurants, transportation, recommended routes, etc. He was also extremely thoughtful about his recommendations and had such a congenial and friendly manner, I felt immediately at ease. Sanjay's hotel team staff were also equally helpful and friendly and there was a nice working atmosphere amongst them. It was very kind of them to be so patient with our French when they easily could have spoken to us in English. My sons felt very comfortable with all the hotel staff. The neigbourhood was lovely and the hotel is situated very conveniently within it. We were literally minutes away from anything we wanted to do - bateau mouche, st chappelle, louvre, notre dame, berthillon, pompidou centre. There are many great restaurants in the area and Sanjay and his team made very appropriate and thoughtul recommendations and handled the reservations. The rooms were lovely, quiet and clean. We stayed in the junior suite and a classic room. The junior suite had a fantastic bathroom with a wonderful jacuzzi. In both rooms, the bathrooms were sparkling white and the showers had great pressure and hot water. The complimentary breakfast was a very nice way to start the day and the food was simple and of good quality. We have raved so enthusiastically about the Artus Hotel that my husband can't wait to stay there and we are planning our next trip to Paris already.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service from Staff”
Reviews.Author: Viajer008
Reviews.Content: We have never experienced such great service from staff at any other hotel. They were always asking to help us and did so. Also the hotel is very clean, the breakfast very good and the location is great. We would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: TassieAustralia
Reviews.Content: We choose the Artus Hotel after extensive research on Trip Advisor. We booked through bookings.com and upon receipt of the electronic confirmations, called to confirm the booking. As the e-booking had not gone through to the hotel at the time of the call, the hotel promptly called us back (in Australia) immediate after it was confirmed to assure us that everything was ok. We spent 2 nights here in early October 2008 as part of the last leg of our 4 week honeymoon trip through Europe. By the time we arrived at Artus, weâ€™ve been through a fair few hotels. The room were relatively large by European standards. The room fittings and furniture was modern and relatively new. Most importantly, the bedding was clean and very comfortable. The front desk staff spoke very good English and were very keen to assist with any questions we had and were on hand to offer recommendations to plenty of good restaurants around the area. The location of the hotel was ideal as we were only going to have 1 full day in Paris. The hotel itself is situated in the heart of the Latin quarters off Boulevard Saint-Germain. In terms of attractions, the hotel is just a short stroll from Institut de France and just across from there the Musee du Louvre. The Notre Dame is just 15 minutes away. There are plenty of restaurants around so you donâ€™t have to travel far for a cocktail or a good meal. For those who like a bit of shopping, it is definitely the place to be. Shoppers will be spoilt for choice as there is mixture of famous high end and mid range fashion boutiques, a selection of gourmet food stores, art gallerias and antique shops and not to mention stores specialising in Paris memorabilia. As a whole, the hotel met all our expectations and needles to say, we are very pleased to have made this choice! We will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anyone visiting Paris!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 35Clark
Reviews.Content: I spend about 100 days per year traveling, and the Artus is my favorite hotel anywhere. The rooms are perfectly designed and, while trendy, also extremely comfortable and pleasant. The service is impeccable and the entire hotel is spotlessly clean. The food at breakfast is excellent, though not extravagant. The wine offering in the lobby is a plus as well. If the weather is nice and you can get a room with a balcony, make sure to sit outside for a bit. Oh yeah, the location can't be beat either.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous time...a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: dad45227
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 night, 5 days in Paris and could not have been happier with our stay at the Artus Hotel. It is perfectly located in the heart of the Left Bank, which offers guests a true snapshot of life as a Parisian. Anything you could want to see or do is within walking distance or a quick ride on the Metro or RER. We had a Superior Room and it was plenty big. You aren't going to Paris to sit in your hotel room, so it was exactly what we needed. Most importantly the room was VERY clean. The breakfast was a great way to start the day. Fantastic cheeses and breads with an assortment of juices and coffee kicked off our day. Most importantly however is the unbelieveable service you receive from the concierge Sanjay. I travel a lot for work and I am lucky to have stayed in many 5 star hotels and never have I received the level of service that Sanjay provides. He had book our dinner reservations before we arrived (Sensing is the best restaurant I have ever been too) and took care of our transportation to and from the airport. Every morning he helped to get us going in the right direction and offered a locals tips on where to go and what to see. So long as Sanjay is at the Artus Hotel I will never go anywhere else when in Paris!!! The rest of the staff is very good as well...but you just can't clone Sanjay!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for the budget minded traveler”
Reviews.Author: doublefault2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a charming boutuque hotel on the Rue du Buci in the 6th. The location is superb with two Metro stops within a block. While the rooms are on the small side, the appointements are very good and the furnitshings are relatively new ond modern. Sanjay, the day manager/concierge could not be more friendly, helpful and accomodating and the room prices are reasonable by Paris standards.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: bubbacheetah
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing experience at the Artus Hotel and will definately be staying there again on my next trip to Paris. The rooms were extremely comfortable and inviting and my experience was overall superb. Of course, no review is complete without mention of Sanjay, who went well above and beyond to make each and every guest feel comfortable and at home. He may well be this hotel's biggest asset!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff - Nice modern feel”
Reviews.Author: seansheerin
Reviews.Content: We had booked the top floor room at the Artus, with a terrace to view Paris at night. The hotel contacted us to tell us they double booked the room and decided that we were the customer that was NOT going to get the room. Sanjay and Patricia (concierge and front desk) called me (in NJ) and sent emails apologizing and offering a suite at the Hotel de Buci -a sister property 2 doors down the street. I was very upset. However, we loved the Buci, and the staff couldn't have been nicer or more accomodating. They allowed us to use the Artus (complimentary) breakfast room (smart-looking room with a plentiful and tasty breakfast) and also hooked us up with a large suite at the Buci, with champagne, flowers and a fruit basket. We loved the place! Sanjay booked lunch at Jules Verne (w/in the Eiffel Tower) as well as local (6th arr) restaurants for dinner. Every meal was a delight, fresh and delicious and reaonably priced. The Buci / Artus was a great choice, one I'd recommend to anyone considering a romantic get away to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Longtime favorite - like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveler1500
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Artus many times over the past eight years or so, and it just keeps getting better. It doesn't even cross my mind to stay anywhere elsem when I go to Paris. For a 3-star hotel, the quality throughout is better than many 4-stars. Rooms are small but have everything you need - beds and linens are good, bathrooms are well-appointed, and everything is extremely clean. Staff is terrific, helpful, and always friendly. If you're new to Paris - this location is ideal ... 2 minute walk to St. Germain des Pres; lovely 5 minute walk to the Seine (or an hour walk if you want to browse the antique and art galleries as you go) - and you're directly across the river from the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Artus...”
Reviews.Author: Sthlm_man
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful trip to Paris where we stayed at the Artus. The location can't be beat... Left Bank, easy walking distance from the major attractions(Louvre, Notre Dame, Orsay, etc;). The room was a little small, but I didn't expect anything spacious on the Left Bank. In fact, they had some ingenious ways to utilize the space provided... like pull out drawers for suitcases. Great breakfast, lots to choose from without losing that French appeal. The staff was great, especially Patricia and Sanjay. They were very helpful and friendly and helped to make our stay memorable. I was in contact with Sanjay prior to our trip and he helped with some great tips of things to do as well as making a booking at a wonderful restaurant(Le Christine). We will definately consider the Artus on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A very satisfactory Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: shri420
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Artus over Christmas this past month and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The hotel was clean and the service was responsive throughout. There is no question that the principal concierge Sanjay is a master of his profession and his attention to details and anxiety to be helpful was truly outstanding. The rest of the staff were also extremely helpful. The rooms, as with most Paris hotels, were small--we had a 'superior room' that had windows into an inner courtyard; very quiet, nicely appointed--and much more storage space than the allegedly 5-star hotel in which we had been staying in London prior to our arrival. No closet, true, but the armoire proved adequate along with some shelves. We found the heating to be fine--responsive and quiet. A major plus for the Artus, is that just outside is the virtual center of the Left Bank--rue Buci and its extensions are great places to just 'be' for a while; good cafes, a number of satisfactory restaurants in the vicinity--we enjoyed the branch of Leons of Bruxelles--amazing mussels--just at the opposite corner of Buici and Blvd Saint-Germaine-des-Pres. Walking distance to Notre Dame, Ste Chappelle, the Cluny Museum--tho' we try never to walk to a Museum, the Louvre (ditto) and if you are really fit, the Musee Orsay. Two Metro stations are close at hand and some very convenient bus routes. Our rate was not cheap--I think it was 243 Euros--it included a very fine breakfast that included eggs and bacon/sausage, plus pastries, breads, cheeses, fruit, toast and some fine coffee. The only glitch was that one morning when the regular breakfast room server was off, a request for decaf coffee produced hot water and some powder. The rest appeared to be brewed and hearty decaf coffee. One drawback was that the wireless internet access in the room was on a pay basis. A free PC in the lobby offered no-cost internet access. I would strongly recommend this hotel for its staff, its facilities, its overall hospitality and its location.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NBChrista
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Artus for our honeymoon in October of 2007. We chose it based on reviews and a good deal combining hotel + flight on Expedia, but still paid very close to rack rate. The location is outstanding++. Check in was straightforward. The room was tiny but clean and the shower was lovely. Bed was large and comfortable with great bedding. The toiletries provided in the room were obviously recycled from visitors past (in little customized "ARTUS" boxes and jars) and were looking a little worn. Cleaning was acceptable. Closet space was tight but efficient, there was no iron. Front desk staff were a mixed bag. We had nothing but good experiences (although one night we waited quite a long time for the night staff to answer the doorbell and let us in when we rang at around 12:30 am). The internet was unusable during our stay - one of the night staff kindly looked up baseball scores for us which was lovely. We saw a couple of women show up to check in one afternoon, looking extremely travel-weary and with two large heavy-looking bags each, who were told by the two women at the front desk (who had no other guests to help) that the guests would have to lug their bags up to their rooms by themselves as there were no male desk staff working who could help them. I don't expect valet service, but a small kindness goes a long way. The decor is dated but the lobby is clean and at times the hotel smelled a little odd, but we generally enjoyed our hotel stay for what it was - a super jumping-off spot from which to enjoy Paris. Incidentally, if you don't mind walking about 800 meters with luggage on a quiet street then it's a direct metro trip to CDG airport from (I think) the Saint Michel station. This was a huge bonus for us. Local restaurants were fantastic, especially Allard. The Paris Pass was a colossal waste of money, but the (MUCH MUCH CHEAPER) Paris Museum Pass (which can be purchased at any museum) is a great deal. I would stay in the same neighbourhood anytime I was in Paris, but at the Artus only in the event of an excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “this is paris!!!!..you dont need the ritz!”
Reviews.Author: rms555
Reviews.Content: incredible experience...all i can tell you is of the one junior suite because that is where we stayed....a beautiful room with large bath...exc water pressure....lovely terrace overlooking st germain de pres..great staff...i happen to be a very picky northeasterner..id def come here again and i plan to !

Reviews.Title: “November 2007 Artus Review”
Reviews.Author: Jodicarm
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Artus and since we used this site for information, I wanted to share our experiences there. All of the staff were friendly, professional, and approachable. No signs of the aforementioned surly Patricia. Sanjay, the manager, was wonderful. The evening staff were also helpful. We booked our room via Expedia for $245/night. I feel we got a good value for the price. After all, this IS Paris. Yes, the room (132) was small, but it was clean, the bed was comfortable, the pillows perfect. The only complaints that I had, which I shared with a receptive Sanjay, was that the rug was showing signs of wear, and the paint on the wall in the toilet area was chipping. The modern decor of the lobby and breakfast area was perfect. Breakfast downstairs was good if you didn't want to face Paris too early. And at 15 euros each, it was comparable to what a decent breakfast would cost. The location is great, the St. Germain des Pres area is full of activity, and anything you could want is steps away. It was a little noisy on Friday and Saturday nights, very, very late, but it's a small price to pay for the location. The small gripe we do have was the heating system would make a annoying noise each time it would turn on/off. Not good when you're just about to drift off to sleep. So I guess I would recommend this hotel. Would we go back? We like to try new things, so probably not. But, as I mentioned, it IS an excellent value in a very expensive city. So, what are you waiting for???

Reviews.Title: “About the desk manager”
Reviews.Author: Julia87
Reviews.Content: By reading the previous critics, I think there's a big problem about Patricia, the woman in charge of the reception of the Artus Hotel. I've stayed there several times, and I was very pleased of everything that offers this amazing hotel in Paris. But also disapointed of the attitude of this woman, who's very rude with the guests. How can a so nice hotel like the Artus could put someone like her in charge of something ? Pity ... But every time I go there, I'm happy Sanjay is there to make me feel at home !

Reviews.Title: “Artus: a good base for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: jonbuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Artus 2 nights end of August 2007. Had booked it on the basis of review of its old name / ownership as Hotel Buci Latin, it has clearly lost some of its character and has become more of a "chain" hotel since then. Still, the staff were very helpful and the hotel clean and nice. Had a suite, which let's face it was a decent size room with a sofa, but maybe is the norm for Paris. At 300 euros per night seemed a little pricey by London standards but not excessive. Nice view from Balcony bustling street below. Loads of places nearby to eat and drink, so lack of a bar or restaurant not a problem. Breakfast not great, but at least was inclusive. Has to be said biggest plus for this place is superb location, walking distance to most of the tourist traps and as mentioned plenty of good bars and restaraunts. Also the staff were excellent, set us up with bookings at two excellent restaurants, happy to provide directions arrange taxis etc. Overall recommended, I am sure we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Patricia .... What's that ???”
Reviews.Author: Amyl__35
Reviews.Content: I've been twice at the Artus last winter, I just remembered the excellent service from all the staff I just came back in this hotel for two days, and I was really really disapointed by the service of what we're supposed to call the head receptionist.. Patricia. she had such a bad attitude, not only with me but with a lot of customers. It was horrible.... She's rude, she doesnt know how to talk properly to the people and to her staff, specially the cleaning lady! What a pity for this supposed-to-be excellent hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location ....Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Rinkman
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be beat....So many cafes and restaurants to choose from....People everywhere throughout the day and night. The rooms are very small no doubt about it....However I dont spend much time in the room so it really didnt bother me. The decor was nice and the bed was comfortable. That being said a tad bigger might help a bit. However the room size would not deter me from staying here again. I prefer being out of any room walking around Paris.........even if it were 5 times the size!!!!!!! Sanjay was wonderful as were the rest of the staff...they would help /do whatever you needed with a smile!!!!!!! The breakfast which was included for us, was very good and a great way to start the day! Now, my real drawback here though was the internet access. The computer downstairs which is free doesn't work very well, if you can even get it to work. They do have it in the room however the cost is sort of out of line even for Europe. Like another reviewer said...some people have to stay in touch...Over my 17 days in Paris and Italy the internet access here was by far the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but...”
Reviews.Author: FranÃ§ois_Bogacz
Reviews.Content: It's the second time we were staying at the Artus Hotel. This time, we had booked a double standard room, because according to the reservation desk, its was "bigger than the superior room, since it was designed for handicapped people". Well, I can imagine how small the "superior" room must be, considering the size of our "bigger" room. Even according to with St-Germain standards, this room was really small. The staff is very friendly, except the desk manager, a very snobby woman, who insisted to explain to me that they DID have Internet access in the room, through the phone line (!), whereas I was asking if they had Internet access through an Ethernet line. I then asked if they had Wifi access and was offered a horrible price/hour. As for the Macintosh in the hall with free ADSL access, it's an old and slow machine. For somebody who likes to stay connected even though he's on vacations, Artus is definitely not the place to stay - free Internet access is a standard in most four stars hotels in Paris. There are other minor point that show that this hotel is not very well managed : a light broken in the room but never replaced, some paint peeling off the wall in the (otherwise nicely designed) bathroom, some designer ceiling lightings fixed too low on top of the desk, so that every time you get up from the chair, you bang your head on them. Last but not least : the so-called "bigger but standard rooms" are on the main floor, at the back of the reception, so they can be noisy at night when other guest are coming back from their night out. The windows are on the level of the backstreet, which is a quiet one, but it's always a little bit weird to have somebody peeking at you when you open the stores...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible management”
Reviews.Author: LoPhat
Reviews.Content: I was very excited when I found the Artus and had high expectations for it based on the great ratings it received here at Trip Advisor. My disappointment started upon arrival when I discovered how small the rooms are. I've traveled around the world and only budget hotels in Tokyo are smaller than this. Oh well, I thought, the location is great and I've heard good things about the service. Everything was fine until something broke in my room that required fixing. Not only could management not get their act together to resolve the situation promptly, they struck a decidedly nasty attitude on top of it all. I would recommend against choosing the Artus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location/Perfect host”
Reviews.Author: BuciBoy
Reviews.Content: The location is unbeatable. Make sure you ask Sanjay for his recommendations regarding anything you want to do or see. He gave us the best adivce re restaurants, museums and arranged a wonderful dinner cruise for us on the Seine. We had a truly wonderful vacation and were made to feel appreciated every day.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, great location, tiny room.”
Reviews.Author: bruce14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Artus for 6 nights in August 2007. The location is excellent, close to everything and Rue Buci is full of interesting cafes and restaurants. The hotel is clean and modern, the staff friendly and efficient. Breakfast worthwhile only if included in the price, standard buffet fare, lots of other choices right outside the door. The classic rooms are exceptionally small â€“ one person has to sit on the bed while the other moves around the room, the desk chair dosn't pull out from the desk before hitting the bed, my wife would have appreciated a mirror in addition to the one in the bathroom. Good for one or two nights but try a superior room or another hotel for anything longer. The Yellow Van shuttle to and from the airport was prompt and efficient. We found Rick Steves walking tours provided a good overview of the city, don't miss the Pere Lachaise cemetary.

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: theshoemaker
Reviews.Content: Artus is a very nice, small and friendly hotel right in the heart of St. Germain. the location is just perfect being 15 meters from Boulevard St. Germain, a minute walking distance from two metro stations and very close to a lot of shops, restaurants, markets, bakerys and pretty much anything else. the room we had was very small but nice in terms of style, decor and cleanliness. for a deluxe room, it was very snug though, the table was so close to the bed the chair was hard to pull out, the closet was a bit hard to use for the same reason. bathroom and the shower were nice, glass door on the toilet was a bit much though. obviously not see-through, but didn't feel very private because you could hear a breath outside. airconditioning was good. a big plus for the windows having blinding curtains because otherwise it would've been very light very early. the windows could've been thicker though, there was slight noice from the small street outside due to a bar being almost straight underneath us. nothing unbearable though. The concierge was excellent and helped us out with some non-hotel related problems we had, outstanding service. breakfast was nice for a small place like this. we had some problems with the wireless internet connection, the system was a bit odd. I personally consider Artus a better alternative than the close by Bel Ami which I stayed at last time in Paris, price was higher there and the hotel equal. overall we enjoyed our stay a lot, the accomodation itself would get 3 stars from me but because of the good service I'm going with 4.

Reviews.Title: “Seamless stay in Paris, but the room was a bit small”
Reviews.Author: Alan001
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great location at the heart of St Germain. The lift was a little terrifying, the breakfast was basic but easy and the room was small but very pretty and well designed. Service was really friendly and most of all our whole experience was just really easy and satisfying. HIghly recommended (unless you're claustrophobic).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: VM2
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location in the centre of St Germain De Pres just off Boulevard St Germain.Lots of restaurants,bars and famous cafes in area as well as lots of art galleries.Walking distance to Bon Marche a great shopping area as well as the Louvre and Notre Dame.The Artus is very modern inside and though the bedrooms are small they have been very well laid out and have used the space to the max.Loved the rainhead shower and also the very comfortable bed! We absolutely loved staying in this part of Paris and if we ever returned to Paris we would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel and staff ever”
Reviews.Author: Jersey60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous. It is very sophisticated and contemporary in style. The rooms are small but very modern in design and extremely comfortable. The location is great and it is easy to get to all the major sites and museums by foot, bus, or train. The staff made our visit exceptional. They were friendly, interested in our daily comings and goings, absolutely motivated to make our experience in Paris special. Sanjay and the entire staff became our friends away from home. We will stay there again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and close to nutella-filled crepes too!”
Reviews.Author: DC/VATravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I just returned yesterday from a 6 day trip to Paris with my girlfriends and we could not have been happier with the Hotel Artus. No review would be complete without acknowledging and thanking Sanjay for being the perfect host, travel guide and smiling face after returning from a long day of sightseeing (and shopping, boy did we do a lot of shopping). There were four of us total so we had 2 per room (Room 101 and 111). We were told that Room 101 was the largest in the hotel and it was very big compared to what one normally gets in Europe. The bed was comfortable with nice linens (though no top sheet which might just be European but sort of plays on my yuck factor) and the bathroom was huge. The weird thing about the shower in Room 101 is that there is no shower door, curtain, pane of glass - nada. So, with a rain-type shower head you basically get water everywhere but we made do and covered the floor in towels which was fine. There is a small armoire which was plenty big enough for two of us and a small desk and flat screen TV. The hotel was not very noisy (aside from a small child screaming for apricot juice at an early hour) and we slept great even though we were on the street level. Room 111 was very similar to ours although their shower had a half a pane of glass which probably helped with splashing! The lobby is very modern with comfy couches and cool artwork and though we never made it downstairs for breakfast (why eat in the hotel when there are tons of great cafes right around the corner and a crepe stand 2 blocks away on St. Germain Blvd - did I mention the crepe stand yet? It's right outside St. Germain church and is truly a divine experience.) You can't beat the hotel for location as it's super close to the metro but I must say we pretty much walked everywhere as the city is very walkable and you get to see more (especially when the gay pride parade is going on which I highly recommend for a unique Parisian experience - it rivals NYC and Washington DC for sure! Great fun!). Anyway, I am pretty picky about my hotels and typically try to stay in 4/5 stars in the US and prefer hotels like the W, Ritz and Four Seasons (when I can get a good deal) and this hotel, while not Ritz-level, has the vibe of a W with the hospitality of a cozy bed and breakfast. It was so nice to be able to stop for drinks at the end of the day at Cafe Mabillon or Chai and just pop back into the room to change or drop off bags. There are plenty of great restaurants and we had an amazing pre-departure Italian meal at Del Papa which is only 2 doors from the Artus. Don't miss the spaghetti bolognese or carbonara and frankly it's a nice change from jambon and fromage! There is plenty of shopping right around the hotel and lots of art galleries for window shopping. We felt very very safe in the area and the cafes were hopping until 2am and on though we never heard much if any street noise. We searched and searched in an attempt to find the right hotel in Paris and we did not go wrong with the Artus. It's Fodor's rated which made us feel a little more secure but trust us, you'll be very happy here. Ask Sanjay about where to go, where to eat, or even for a car to get you back to the airport at 6am (that held lots of bags filled with sale month goodies!) and you will not be disappointed. He's just the best as we can't say enough good things about him. Try restaurant Entrecote and Cafe Visconti for dinner in the neighborhood too. There's also great gelato right around the corner and a crepe stand. Did we mention the crepe stand?! I think my thighs now look like nutella-filled crepes after this trip but boy was it worth it. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Amzzely
Reviews.Content: What a great time we had at the Artus Hotel ! Everything was perfect ; the location, the room, the breaffast, the staff, specially Sanjay and Matthew, thanks so much for your kindness !

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Artus is hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: pommehomme
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice: once in 1996 and most recently in May 2007. All Paris hotels are expensive with small rooms and this is no exception. However, the location is nearly perfect in the 6th Arrondisement, just off the St. Germain-des-Pres, near a number of Metro stations and an easy walk to almost anywhere in central Paris. The hotel has been remodeled and the rooms are efficient with very nice bathrooms and large showers, though not a lot of room. The heating and air conditioning system is superb as are the windows and the rooms are quiet. Sanjay, the concierge, is a joy. He is extremely helpful with all the details of life in a large European capital. He made excellent restaurant suggestions and made reservations, summoned taxies, and generally made the stay a pleasure. The remainder of the staff is very helpful as well. A large British-type breakfast buffet with meat, cheese, eggs, and pastries is included in the room tariff. I will be back; this is my favorite hotel in my favorite part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Another happy visit to the Artus”
Reviews.Author: thehatladyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my second stay at the Artus, and it continues to live up to its excellent record of service I found last year. Staff is extremely helpful; hotel is very clean and modern. Location is unbeatable! I especially recommend this hotel for first-time visitors to Paris as they go out of their way to help you with any needs or requests you have (from the mundane "where is the nearest pharmacy" to the more difficult "can you help me get a reservation at this fancy restaurant.") One tip if you are travelling with teenagers there: you may wish to ask the hotel in advance to clear the room of any "sensitive reading material" (discovered this in the desk drawer.) I am not sure if it was left there by hotel management or a previous guest -but it was definitely not what I wanted my teenagers to see.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly unfussy but not overly modern -- just right!”
Reviews.Author: oceanhouse
Reviews.Content: I am always trying new hotels in St. Germain, looking for the hidden gem that I'll become loyal to on my twice-yearly solo business trip to Paris...The Artus is probably the closest I've come to finding the dream hotel. I like the clean and contemporary look of both the public spaces and the room (the headboard with lights and shelf space is a real plus!), and the bathroom is both modern and functional without being cold. The public space computer is a great feature (although I found it not working twice, the manager let me use her own computer behind the reception desk, which was very thughtful). The location can't be beat -- 5 minutes walk to St. Michele, 2 minutes walk to Cafe Deux Magots. It's on a busy market street, which for some could be a negative feature but for me was a positive -- as a single traveller I like to blend in when outside, and I found any number of sidewalk cafes within two blocks of the hotel where I could sit alone with a book and a glass of wine to pass the time. But then, I've never been bothered by noise, and some people are. I'll give it an 8 out of 10 and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful..never underestimate the power of great service!”
Reviews.Author: cleifur
Reviews.Content: We stayed based on the positive reviews here and would have to say it's even better. The location couldn't be better, in the heart of St. Germain, and the rooms are very tastefully appointed. But the best thing for us was the service, which was more 5 star than 3 star, thanks to Sanjay. He is the most pleasant, effective, hard working concierge we've ever encountered, all of his recommendations were spot on and he went (way) out of his way to help us. Next time we go to Paris, we'll stay wherever Sanjay is working.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Paris First Timers!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinBuddy
Reviews.Content: As many of you many know choosing a hotel for your first time to Paris is quite challenging. The reviews on this website helped us to decide on the Artus and we were very glad that we did (thank you!). Although small compared to american hotels, the room was clean with a very contemporary/modern design, flat screen TV (always a plus), and the bathroom looked brand new. Ammenities included a towel warmer, hair dryer, and the usual toiletries. There was an Apple Computer in the lobby where you can surf the internet for free, but you can also purchase an internet card so you can use your laptop in the room via WiFi. We were looking forward to meeting Sanjay but he was on "holiday," but the entire staff was very helpful, especially Patricia. All spoke english and made great recommendations. The hotel is on/near one of the best streets in Paris! Breakfast was okay at the hotel but everything at your doorstep! Restaurants, cafes (PAULS is great for breakfast), a flower shop, a fruit market, a supermarket, chocolatiers, stationary store, book stores, clothing shops, art studios, must I go on? It is near 3 metro stops. Walk down to St Germain and you'll end up at LV, Gucci, Lacoste, etc. Walk up Rue di Buci and you'll end up at the Seine. Take a detour, get lost on the the streets and you will always find your way. It was great! In other words we highly recommend this hotel, especially for Paris first timers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Artus”
Reviews.Author: H&TNorwich
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel. It's the fourth time we've stayed in a 'Design Hotel' and once again we were pleased. Great situation, close to some lovely little cafes, restaurants, seafood bars etc. Only five minutes from great shopping too. The staff at the hotel were great when we asked them to recommend places to eat and were happy to make reservations for us, complete with map! All recommendations were good (especially the French bistro called Allards, which we also rate for French cuisine). The breakfast was better than expected and all food fresh and well presented. Rooms are small but stylish and plenty big enough for time spent in them. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: camer00n
Reviews.Content: I've been to Paris about a dozen times now, and have long been in search of a good hotel which doesn't cost the earth. The Artus is definitely the one!! It's in a great location, if you want to be in the middle of a lively area with great bars and shops just outside. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are absolutely gorgeous, each one with a different theme - stayed in the African themed one which was very spacious (for Paris hotels which are normally shoebox sized, for American visitors though it's probably pretty small), airy, comfortable, well lit, well stocked bathroom etc. It's not superslick, and there's a tiny tiny bit of shabby chic around the edges, so it's not Hotel Costes designer luxury, but pretty amazing nevertheless at the price. Would recommend it heartily, it's going to be my base in Paris from now on...

Reviews.Title: “Tiny But Clean, Chic, Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: Feldavision
Reviews.Content: Pros: Located in middle of the most charming street in the Left Bank. Modern and clean, if you don't go for that overly wrought, fou-fou French Louis style (we don't). Very friendly front desk happy to speak English when "Bonjour" and "Bon Soir" is all you can muster. Lovely quality materials like marble baths, new fixtures, down bedding, modern lighting. Cons: Our room was so tiny, we feel like our 23-foot Winnebago actually had more space to move around in. Only one person could pass by the bed or bath at a time. (In all fairness, that's Europe--and I think we had one of the smaller rooms.) The TV channels are sketchy and there's nothing for an English speaker to watch, not even one pay channel/BBC/etc. For such a modern place, I expected an iPod dock or even a standard radio/alarm clock/CD player, but there was nothing. Lastly, skip the breakfast (15 euros per person, served in a somewhat surreal basement room) unless you're starving .... there are a hundred cheaper options outside the door, our favorite being the Croque Madame at Cafe Buci down the street, or the super-affordable pastries and coffee at the Croissanterie just around the corner on Blvd. St. Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay at Artus”
Reviews.Author: amy_chicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Artus Hotel for a short vacation over Christmas. We were very pleased with our stay - great design, great room, great location - tons to do within walking distance. We most especially appreciated the service provided from the concierge, Sanjay. Sanjay went out of his way to make us feel at home during our short visit - it's the best service I have ever had at a hotel. I would definitely stay at the Artus again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Will Definitely Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights last week, had a wonderful time. We booked the junior suite, since we needed the extra room for a crib for our 11-month-old. The size was adequate for the three of us with our bags and the crib (which the hotel provided). The balcony was a bonus; after the baby was asleep we could sit outside and breathe-in Paris. The bathroom was enormous, modern, beautifully clad in marble and squeaky clean. The staff were exceptionally helpful (thanks Patricia, Sanjay and all). The breakfast was very nice and the coffee outstanding. The neighborhood has everything one could need, even for an infant. Plus, a short walk to Notre Dame, Louvre and Luxembourg Gardens. We will definitely stay here again.
